## Description

{{< meta description >}}


## Your Responsibilities

- Contribute to the design, development, and evaluation of a prototype LLM system for administrative and research support tasks
- Develop Python-based components and data processing pipelines
- Experiment with machine learning and large language model techniques in an HPC environment

## Your Profile
- Enrollment in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Science, Data Science, Computational Sciences, or a related discipline at a Swiss university
- Solid programming skills in Python
- Some familiarity with machine learning concepts and common frameworks (e.g.,
PyTorch, TensorFlow, scikit-learn)
- Ideally, experience with LLMs and/or working on HPC clusters (SLURM, GPU
workflows, etc.)
- Strong communication skills in English (working language of the project)
Applications from candidates with less experience in specific domains are still welcome. The motivation to learn and develop is highly valued.

## We Offer
- A dynamic, interdisciplinary research environment in a growing AI lab
- Hands-on experience with modern LLM technologies and real-world applications
- Flexible working hours and the possibility of hybrid work arrangements

## How to Apply

Please submit the following as a single PDF
- A short motivation statement (max. 1 page)
- CV
- Current transcript of records
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.
For questions, please contact Asst. Prof. Christian Baumgartner ([christian.baumgartner@unilu.ch](mailto:christian.baumgartner@unilu.ch)).
